summary: This document outlines the confidential plea negotiation terms for Jeffrey Epstein, detailing his agreement to plead guilty to state charges in Palm Beach County in exchange for the closure of federal investigations. It specifies the charges, sentencing recommendations, and Epstein's concessions regarding victim lawsuits.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the plea negotiations, agreeing to plead guilty to state charges of lewd and lascivious battery on a child, solicitation of minors for prostitution, and sexual activity with minors.

events.title: Epstein Plea Agreement and Sentencing
events.description: Epstein agrees to plead guilty to state charges filed by the Palm Beach County State Attorney's Office and receive a joint recommendation of at least two years in prison without probation.

events.title: Closure of Federal Investigations
events.description: Upon Epstein's state court plea and sentencing, the FBI and U.S. Attorney's Office agree to close their investigations into him.

keyFacts: Epstein agreed to plead guilty to state charges including lewd and lascivious battery on a child and solicitation of minors for prostitution.
The plea deal included a binding joint recommendation for at least two years in prison without probation or community control.
Epstein waived his right to appeal and agreed not to contest jurisdiction or victim status in potential federal civil suits under 18 U.S.C. § 2255.
The FBI and U.S. Attorney's Office agreed to close their investigations once Epstein was sentenced in state court.
The agreement required Epstein to acknowledge that identified victims were minors victimized under federal statutes 18 U.S.C. §§ 2422 and/or 2423.
